wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.connectivity

Class ConnectedComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.connectivity.ConnectedComponent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConnectedComponent2D, ConnectedComponent3D

    public abstract class ConnectedComponent
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows connected components labeling in a binary image. This abstract class has derived classes to label components slice by slice in 2D or by considering components in 3D images. Some filtering criteria for filtering the connected components are supported :
    • Minimal volume for the components (taking into account the calibration)
    • Remove connected components that touch the boundary of the image.
    An option in the filtering method allows to modify the input image to set random grey levels on each component. RESTRICTIONS The total number of connected components labeled must remain smaller than the number of labels available which is less than 2* Short.MAX_VALUE -2. This can be guaranteed by imposing the connected components considered have at least (total number of voxels)/(2* Short.MAX_VALUE -2) voxels.

    • Method Detail

      • getImage

        public ImageCore getImage()
        Returns:
        The image which is used as input for labeling

      • getLabel

        public short getLabel(int x,
                      int y,
                      int z)
        retrieves the label of a voxel (after calling doComponents)
        Parameters:
        x - first coordinate of the voxel
        y - second coordinate of the voxel
        z - third coordinate of the voxel
        Returns:
        the label of the input voxel (0 if not in any connected component)

      • getLabeledComponents

        public static ConnectedComponent getLabeledComponents(ImageCore inputImage,
                                                      LabelingPolicy labelingPolicy,
                                                      int foregroundColor,
                                                      boolean removeBorderComponent,
                                                      double thresholdComponentVolume,
                                                      boolean setRandomColors)
                                               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Constructs a ConnectedComponent derived class instance with relevant dimension (2D or 3D) and labels the components. The input image must have type Gray8. Filters the image components according to two criteria:
        • Possibly remove the components which are on the edge of the image
        • Possibly remove the components with size bellow some threshold
        Parameters:
        inputImage - : input (probably binary) image, the components of which to compute.
        labelingPolicy - Can be 3D components labeling, or slice by slice against a given axis.
        foregroundColor - label of the 1's in the input image inputImage
        removeBorderComponent - true if the components which are on the edge of the image should be removed by filtering
        thresholdComponentVolume - minimal volume for filtering (taking into account the calibration) for the components. 0 if no minimal volume is required
        setRandomColors - true if the colors of the original image should be set according to the components labels.
        Returns:
        an instance of a concrete derived class for ConnectedComponent
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - in case the number of connected components exceeds the Short.MAX_VALUE (32767) or if the image doesn't have type GRAY8.

      • getLabeledComponents

        public static ConnectedComponent getLabeledComponents(ImageCore inputImage,
                                                      LabelingPolicy labelingPolicy,
                                                      int foregroundColor,
                                                      boolean removeBorderComponent,
                                                      double thresholdComponentVolume,
                                                      ComponentRemovalPredicate removalPredicate,
                                                      boolean keepPredicate,
                                                      boolean setRandomColors)
                                               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Constructs a ConnectedComponent derived class instance with relevant dimension (2D or 3D) and labels the components. The input image must have type Gray8. Filters the image components according to two criteria:
        • Possibly remove the components which are on the edge of the image
        • Possibly remove the components with size bellow some threshold
        Parameters:
        inputImage - : input (probably binary) image, the components of which to compute.
        labelingPolicy - Can be 3D components labeling, or slice by slice against a given axis.
        foregroundColor - label of the 1's in the input image inputImage
        removeBorderComponent - true if the components which are on the edge of the image should be removed by filtering
        thresholdComponentVolume - minimal volume for filtering (taking into account the calibration) for the components. 0 if no minimal volume is required
        removalPredicate - a predicate according to which components should be filtered out
        keepPredicate - true if we should keep the components with a voxel satisfying removalPredicate, and false if we should remove the components with a voxel satisfying removalPredicate
        setRandomColors - true if the colors of the original image should be set according to the components labels.
        Returns:
        an instance of a concrete derived class for ConnectedComponent
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - in case the number of connected components exceeds the Short.MAX_VALUE (32767) or if the image doesn't have type GRAY8.

      • getNumberOfComponents

        public int getNumberOfComponents()
        retrieves the number of connected components (as constructed by doComponents)
        Returns:
        the number of components detected.

      • getComponentInfo

        public ComponentInfo getComponentInfo(short label)
        Retrieves the informations about a component for its label may return null if the component does not exist or has been erased because below volume threshold or on the border.
        Parameters:
        label - the component label (Can be negative and can be shifted to access a list index)
        Returns:
        the ComponentInfo instance of the component with the considered label. returns null if the component info is undefined
        See Also:
        indexFromLabel(short)

      • getComponentInfo

        public ComponentInfo getComponentInfo(int labelIndex)
        Retrieves the informations about a component for its label index. may return null if the component does not exist or has been erased because below volume threshold or on the border.
        Parameters:
        labelIndex - the component label (non negative integer)
        Returns:
        the ComponentInfo instance of the component with the considered label. returns null if the component info is undefined

      • getVoxelRepresentants

        public java.util.ArrayList<VoxelInt> getVoxelRepresentants()
        Retrieve a collection of voxels, with one voxel in each (possibly filtered) connected component.
        Returns:
        the array of voxel representatives of components

      • getLabelsAsImage

        public ImageCore getLabelsAsImage()
        Converts the labels of the voxels to gray levels in a regular image for further processing. If the largest label fits into a Byte, the output image has type GRAY8. Otherwise, the output image has type GRAY16.
        Returns:
        An image with gray level values giving the connected component label for each voxel.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a human readable string representation of this instance
        See Also:
        Object.toString()
